message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.AI 

This paper is about designing private boosting algorithms for efficient and noise-tolerant PAC learning. The paper discusses the sample complexity bounds for the large-margin halfspace learner, which is a common problem in machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.IT (Information Theory) as the paper discusses the use of boosting and differential privacy. The paper also discusses the use of random label noise, which falls under the sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper uses standard techniques from the theory of large-margin classification, which falls under the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
